DELETE /accounts/{identifier}/devices/po.description: Delete a device settings policy. Returns the remaining policies for the account.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

GET /accounts/{identifier}/devices/{uuid.description: Fetch one-time use admin override code for a device. This relies on the Admin Override setting being enabled in your device configuration.

1.description: Override code that is valid for 1 hour.

3.description: Override code that is valid for 3 hours.

6.description: Override code that is valid for 6 hours.

12.description: Override code that is valid for 12 hour2.

24.description: Override code that is valid for 24 hour.2.

200.description: List Admin Override code for device response

1.description: Override code that is valid for 1 hour.

3.description: Override code that is valid for 3 hours.

6.description: Override code that is valid for 6 hours.

12.description: Override code that is valid for 12 hour2.

24.description: Override code that is valid for 24 hour.2.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: List Admin Override code for device response failure

PATCH /accounts/{identifier}/devices/pol.description: Update the default device settings policy for an account.

allow_mode_switch.description: Whether to allow the user to switch WARP between modes.

allow_updates.description: Whether to receive update notifications when a new version of the client is available.

allowed_to_leave.description: Whether to allow devices to leave the organization.

auto_connect.description: The amount of time in minutes to reconnect after having been disabled.

captive_portal.description: Turn on the captive portal after the specified amount of time.

disable_auto_fallback.description: If the dns_server field of a fallback domain is not present, the client will fall back to a best guess of the default/system DNS resolvers, unless this policy option is set.

exclude_office_ips.description: Whether to add Microsoft IPs to split tunnel exclusions.

mode.description: The mode to run the WARP client under.

port.description: The port number when used with proxy mode.

support_url.description: The URL to launch when the Send Feedback button is clicked.

switch_locked.description: Whether to allow the user to turn off the WARP switch and disconnect the client.

default.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

200.description: Update Default Device Settings Policy response

default.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Update Default Device Settings Policy response failure

allow_mode_switch.description: Whether to allow the user to switch WARP between modes.

allow_updates.description: Whether to receive update notifications when a new version of the client is available.

allowed_to_leave.description: Whether to allow devices to leave the organization.

auto_connect.description: The amount of time in minutes to reconnect after having been disabled.

captive_portal.description: Turn on the captive portal after the specified amount of time.

description.description: A description of the policy.
description.example: Policy for test teams.

disable_auto_fallback.description: If the dns_server field of a fallback domain is not present, the client will fall back to a best guess of the default/system DNS resolvers, unless this policy option is set.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

exclude_office_ips.description: Whether to add Microsoft IPs to split tunnel exclusions.

match.description: The wirefilter expression to match devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

precedence.description: The precedence of the policy. Lower values indicate higher precedence. Policies will be evaluated in ascending order of this field.

mode.description: The mode to run the WARP client under.

port.description: The port number when used with proxy mode.

support_url.description: The URL to launch when the Send Feedback button is clicked.

switch_locked.description: Whether to allow the user to turn off the WARP switch and disconnect the client.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

200.description: Update Device Settings Policy response

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Update Device Settings Policy response failure

POST /accounts/{identifier}/devices/poli.description: Create a device settings policy to be applied to certain devices matching the criteria.

allow_mode_switch.description: Whether to allow the user to switch WARP between modes.

allow_updates.description: Whether to receive update notifications when a new version of the client is available.

allowed_to_leave.description: Whether to allow devices to leave the organization.

auto_connect.description: The amount of time in minutes to reconnect after having been disabled.

captive_portal.description: Turn on the captive portal after the specified amount of time.

description.description: A description of the policy.
description.example: Policy for test teams.

disable_auto_fallback.description: If the dns_server field of a fallback domain is not present, the client will fall back to a best guess of the default/system DNS resolvers, unless this policy option is set.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

exclude_office_ips.description: Whether to add Microsoft IPs to split tunnel exclusions.

match.description: The wirefilter expression to match devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

precedence.description: The precedence of the policy. Lower values indicate higher precedence. Policies will be evaluated in ascending order of this field.

mode.description: The mode to run the WARP client under.

port.description: The port number when used with proxy mode.

support_url.description: The URL to launch when the Send Feedback button is clicked.

switch_locked.description: Whether to allow the user to turn off the WARP switch and disconnect the client.

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

200.description: Create Device Settings Policy response

enabled.description: Whether the policy will be applied to matching devices.

name.description: The name of the device settings policy.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Create Device Settings Policy response failure
